text.title: Make Notes on a PDF on PC or Mac
text.head: Make Notes on a PDF on PC or Mac
text.p: This wikiHow teaches you how to take notes and highlight sections on a PDF text document, using your computer's stock PDF reader app. You can use Preview on Mac, and Reader on Windows.
text.head: Steps
Adding Notes to a PDF on Mac

list.item: Open your PDF document in Preview. Double-click the PDF document to open it in Mac's default PDF reader, Preview.

Press on your keyboard. This will show Preview's markup toolbar at the top of your document.
Alternatively, you can click the toolbox icon in the upper-right corner of Preview, next to the search bar.

Click the notepad icon on the markup toolbar. This button looks like a square with horizontal lines in it. You can find it next to the signature icon at the top.
This will create a new, yellow notepad sheet. It looks like a yellow square on your PDF.
Click the yellow square to type. If the yellow notepad square doesn't automatically prompt you to write, click on it again to expand your note sheet.
Type your note into the yellow notepad. Anything you write here will be saved in your note.
Click anywhere on your PDF. This will minimize the pop-up notepad into a yellow square with no text.
Drag the yellow square anywhere on the PDF. You can place your note anywhere on your document.
Click the yellow square to view your note. Clicking will expand the notepad sheet. You can view and edit your note here anytime.

text.head: Adding Textboxes on Mac

list.item: Click the icon on the markup toolbar. You can find this button on the markup toolbar near the upper-left corner. It will add a textbox in the middle of your PDF.
Hold and drag the textbox anywhere on your PDF. You can place the box anywhere on the margins or over the text.

Double-click on the textbox. This will allow you to edit the text in it.
The placeholder text reads "Text" in the text box.
Type your notes in the textbox. You can use your keyboard to enter your comments or questions here.

Click the icon on the markup toolbar. This button is on the far-right end of the markup toolbar at the top. You can edit your text's font, size, and style here.
Select a font from the drop-down.
Enter a number in the "pt" field to change text size.
Click the color box to select a text color.
Use the B, I, U icons for bold, italics, and underline.
Select a text alignment at the bottom.

text.head: Drawing and Sketching on Mac

list.item: Open your PDF document in Preview. Double-click the PDF document to open it in Mac's default PDF reader, Preview.

Press on your keyboard. This will show Preview's markup toolbar at the top of your document.
Alternatively, you can click the toolbox icon in the upper-right corner of Preview, next to the search bar.
Click the pencil icon on the top-right. This is the Sketch tool. You can find it next to the dashed square icon on the markup toolbar at the top.

Sketch a line or curve on your PDF. You can use this to mark or cross certain sections in the text.
If Preview is not sure about your sketch, you'll see a pop-up box in the upper-left corner below the markup toolbar. You can select what you meant to draw here.
Click the three-lines icon on the markup toolbar. It's located next to the notepad icon at the top.

Select a line thickness. The thickness style you select here will automatically apply to your current sketch.
You can also click a line to select it, then change its thickness here later.
Click the color square icon next to the three-lines button. You can select a color for your sketch lines and curves here.

Click the pen icon next to the pencil on the markup toolbar. This is the Draw tool. You can use this tool to draw and sketch free-hand on your PDF.
You can select a thickness and color from the markup toolbar.
Draw freely with your cursor on the PDF. You can use the Draw tool to mark or cross something in the text or take notes anywhere on the page.

text.head: Adding Notes and Highlighting on Windows

list.item:
Open your PDF document in Windows Reader. Double-click the PDF document to open it in Windows's default PDF reader app, Reader.
If you have another reader app set as your default, right-click your PDF document, hover over Open with, and select Reader here.

Select a word, sentence, line or paragraph in your PDF. Hold down your left mouse button, and select where you want to add your note.
This will highlight your selection, and show your options in a pop-up toolbox. You can select Highlight, Add a note, or Copy here.
Click in the pop-up toolbox. This option looks like a speech balloon icon. It will create a small note sheet on your PDF.
Type your note into the small note sheet. Anything you write here will be saved in your note.
Click anywhere on the PDF. This will close the pop-up notepad, and save your note.
Click the highlighted section on your PDF. Your options will pop up on a toolbar.
Click on the pop-up toolbar. This will open your saved note. You can view and edit your note here anytime.
Select any text in your PDF. You can select any word, sentence, line or paragraph with your left mouse button. This will show your markup options in a pop-up toolbox.
Click in the pop-up toolbox. This will highlight your selection in the text. You can easily find this section next time you open your document.
